addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

xj Au
g
1592. M
r
Bodeleie to my L./

page.lettertext:
fol.173r
May it please yo
r
good L. I knowe not
who had undertaken
e conveiance of yo
r
letter
of
e 29 of
e last. It was sent me out of
Ze-
land
, and brought me but to day, by a post
of this contrey, who knewe not
e partie
at deli-
vered it unto him. W
ch
I thought somw
at
requi-
sit to signifie to yo
r
L. because I had some letters
of
e very same date, w
ch
were written me from
Lond
o
,
and delivered to my handes above 6
daies before. Moreover yo
r
L. ma-
keth mention of a letter from her
Ma
tie
to the
states
of this contrey, w
ch
was dispatched from
the
court
about 3 daies before, w
ch
is not yet
come hither. I have sent at this present
a messenger of purpose, to advertise
S
r
Francis
Vere
, w
at
yo
r
L. hath written for geving war-
ning to
e Captaines to keepe their companies
in a readines: wherein I assure my self
for them,
at they will shewe no kinde of back-
wardnes. And though I make full account,
that
e states will shewe no willingnes, yet to
speake w
at
I conjecture, I thinke by way of
sufferance, they will licence them to passe. For
besides
at they expect their forces out of
France,
w
t
e very first winde, w
ch
will quickly be
renforced to double
e number, there are alrea-
dy come to
Sheremberg
in
e Countie of
Zutphen
,
of
e Enseignes they have raised in
e Contrey
of
Juliers,
a 1000 men: and there are as
many comming after, of
e self same Levie:
at I
see no coullo
r
for
e states, to pretend th
e
selves
to be disfournished. Having sent one
unto yow about two daies past, and no occur-
rence comming sins,
at may deserve a longer
letter, I take my humble leave
At
e Hage
Au
g
11 1592
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
